CatDescriptText: Joseph Steward, 5636 Broad Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 22, 1958 with question: "Do you think that the current price of $1.50 for a haircut is too much to pay? Do you favor tipping the barber?" answer reads: "I don't think that it is too much to pay.  After all, everything else is up and the barbers have to live as well as anybody else.  As for tipping, if the barber does a good job, he should be tipped."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Joseph Steward wearing dark flecked coat, triangular patterned scarf, and checked cap, standing in front of light colored wall with decorative trim, right store window displaying dog figurines and neon sign inscribed "flowers"
